qas.question: What is another term for asphalt?
Besides occurrences in Canada, where in the US is asphalt found?
How much of the planet's asphalt is located in Canada?
What is the area amount of the Canadian asphalt deposits?
Where does most of Canada's asphalt end up these days?
Along with the state of Iowa, where else does asphalt occur in unconsolidated sandstones?
Comprised of four large deposits, in which province are most of the world's natural bitumen reserves located?
Where does most of the Canadian oil supply end up?
What is the total area of the Cambodian asphalt deposits?

context: Asphalt/<a0_0>bitumen<a0_0/> also occurs in unconsolidated sandstones known as "oil sands" in <b5_0>Alberta, Canada<b5_0/>, and the similar "tar sands" in <a1_0>Utah<a1_0/>, US. The Canadian province of <b6_0>Alberta<b6_0/> has <a2_0>most<a2_0/> of the world's reserves of natural bitumen, in three huge deposits covering <a3_0><b8_0>142,000 square kilometres<b8_0/><a3_0/> (55,000 sq mi), an area larger than England or New York state. These bituminous sands contain 166 billion barrels (26.4×10^9 m3) of commercially established oil reserves, giving Canada the third largest oil reserves in the world. and produce over 2.3 million barrels per day (370×10^3 m3/d) of heavy crude oil and synthetic crude oil. Although historically it was used without refining to pave roads, nearly all of the bitumen is now used as raw material for <a4_0><b7_0>oil refineries<b7_0/><a4_0/> in Canada and the United States.
